clinical_study.brief_title: Thin Bronchoscope and Virtual Bronchoscopic Navigation System for Tuberculosis
clinical_study.official_title: Thin Bronchoscope and Virtual Bronchoscopic Navigation System for Rapid Detection of Mycobacterium Tuberculosis and Resistant-conferring Mutations

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates the utility of thin bronchoscope and virtual bronchoscopic navigation system (targeted bronchial washing) for detection of M. tuberculosis and resistant-conferring mutations in patients with pulmonary tuberculosis. Time to appropriate treatment and stain/culture conversion are also evaluated.

detailed_description.textblock: Comparisons of detection rate of M. tuberculosis and resistant-conferring mutations between patients who perform CT-guided conventional bronchoscope and patients who perform VBN-guided thin bronchoscope.

primary_outcome.measure: detection of M. tuberculosis and resistant-conferring mutations
primary_outcome.description: evaulation by sensitivity, specificity, PPV and NPV

secondary_outcome.measure: time to appropriate treatment and stain/culture conversion
secondary_outcome.description: date of treatment initiation and stain/culture negative conversion

arm_group.description: Perform bronchial washing using conventional methods. CT-guided thick bronchoscope
Perform bronchial washing using investigational methods. virtual bronchoscopic navigation (VBN)-guided thin bronchoscope (4.0mm of outer diameter)

intervention.description: targeted washing at more adjacent TB lesion using thin bronchoscope and virtual bronchoscopic navigation system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age of 18 or more
- persons who are suspected with pulmonary tuberculosis on radiologic examination
- persons who cannot spit sputum or persons with negative results on sputum AFB smear and TB-PCR or Xpert MTB/RIF assay
Exclusion Criteria:
- persons who do not agree with bronchoscopy (persons who want empirical treatment for TB)
- persons with contraindications for bronchoscopy
- bleeding tendency
- uncontrolled respiratory disease (hypoxemia)
- uncontrolled cardiovascular disease
